required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ATAREAL (Antihistamine Treatment for Allergic Rhinitis in Real Life)
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot, Open, Monocenter, Randomized Two Parallel Groups, Clinical Efficacy Trial: Comparison Continuous Versus on Demand Regimen of Treatment With Levocetirizine 5 mg Oral Tablets, Once a Day, in Adults Suffering From Persistent Allergic Rhinitis (PER) Over 6 Months

brief_summary.textblock: Comparison of clinical efficacy and safety of levocetirizine in PER continuous versus on demand, measured by evolution of individual symptom scores during 6 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Weekly Total 4 Symptom Score (T4SS) During the Treatment Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the treatment period until week 24
primary_outcome.description: The T4SS is the sum of the symptom scores for sneezing, rhinorrhea, nasal pruritus and ocular pruritus. Each of the symptoms is rated retrospectively over the past 24 hours using a 4-point 0 to 3 scale (0 = absent, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate, 3 = severe). Total T4SS is the sum of the idividual scores and ranges from 0-12. Increasing values are associated with increasing severity of disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Monthly Total 4 Symptom Score (T4SS) for Month 1 of the Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During month 1 of the 6 months treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: The T4SS is the sum of the symptom scores for sneezing, rhinorrhea, nasal pruritus and ocular pruritus. Each of the symptoms is rated retrospectively over the past 24 hours using a 4-point 0 to 3 scale (0 = absent, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate, 3 = severe). Total T4SS is the sum of the idividual scores and ranges from 0-12. Increasing values are associated with increasing severity of disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Weekly Individual Symptoms Scores During the Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the treatment period until week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Individual symptom scores include scores for Sneezing, Rhinorrhea, Nasal Pruritus, Ocular Pruritus, and Nasal Congestion. The subjects had to evaluate the severity of the symptoms retrospectively over the past 24 hours (0 = absent, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate, 3 = severe). Increasing scores are associated with increasing severity.

arm_group.description: 5 mg of Levocetirizine (LCTZ) was taken orally once a day.
5 mg of Levocetirizine (LCTZ) was taken whenever needed.

intervention.description: Pharmaceutical form: Tablet Concentration: 5 mg Route of administration: Oral use

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical history of Persistent allergic Rhinitis (PER) requiring treatment known at least since 2 years.
- Positive skin prick test (wheal > 3 mm larger than the diluent control) or Radio Allergo Sorbent Assay (RAST) (>= 3.5 IU/ml) to House Dust Mite (HDM) and Parietaria (less than 1 year).
- Minimum mean Total 4 Symptom Score (T4SS) of 6 over baseline period.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects currently treated by specific parietaria pollen immunotherapy
- Subjects suffering from non-allergic asthma
- Chronic use of inhaled steroids and/or long acting β2 agonists; and/or corticosteroids dependent asthma (severe asthma)
- Atopic dermatitis or urticaria requiring antihistamine treatment or the administration of oral or topical corticosteroids

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study started to enroll patients in March 2005 and concluded in June 2006.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participant Flow refers to the Randomized Set.

group.title: Continuous Treatment (CT)
group.description: 5 mg of Levocetirizine (LCTZ) was taken orally once a day.

group.description: 5 mg of Levocetirizine (LCTZ) was taken whenever needed.

outcome.description: The T4SS is the sum of the symptom scores for sneezing, rhinorrhea, nasal pruritus and ocular pruritus. Each of the symptoms is rated retrospectively over the past 24 hours using a 4-point 0 to 3 scale (0 = absent, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate, 3 = severe). Total T4SS is the sum of the idividual scores and ranges from 0-12. Increasing values are associated with increasing severity of disease.
outcome.time_frame: During the treatment period until week 24
outcome.population: Only patients with a valid mean weekly T4SS during the treatment period were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Mean Weekly Individual Symptoms Scores During the Treatment Period
outcome.description: Individual symptom scores include scores for Sneezing, Rhinorrhea, Nasal Pruritus, Ocular Pruritus, and Nasal Congestion. The subjects had to evaluate the severity of the symptoms retrospectively over the past 24 hours (0 = absent, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate, 3 = severe). Increasing scores are associated with increasing severity.
outcome.time_frame: During the treatment period until week 24
outcome.population: 31 patients were included in the ITT-Set for each treatment group. Only patients with valid mean weekly individual symptoms scores were included in the analysis of this outcome measure. Number of patients analyzed are given for each individual symptoms score.

outcome.time_frame: During month 6 of the 6 months treatment period
outcome.population: 31 patients were included in the ITT-Set for each treatment group. Only patients with valid mean monthly individual symptoms scores at month 6 were included in the analysis of this outcome measure. Number of patients analyzed are given for each individual symptoms score.

group.title: Continuous Treatment (CT)
group.description: 5 mg of Levocetirizine (LCTZ) was taken orally once a day.

group.title: On Demand Treatment (ODT)
group.description: 5 mg of Levocetirizine (LCTZ) was taken whenever needed.

measure.title: Mean Monthly Individual Symptoms Scores During Month 6 of the Treatment Period
measure.description: Individual symptom scores include scores for Sneezing, Rhinorrhea, Nasal Pruritus, Ocular Pruritus, and Nasal Congestion. The subjects had to evaluate the severity of the symptoms retrospectively over the past 24 hours (0 = absent, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate, 3 = severe). Increasing scores are associated with increasing severity.
measure.population: 31 patients were included in the ITT-Set for each treatment group. Only patients with valid mean monthly individual symptoms scores at month 6 were included in the analysis of this outcome measure. Number of patients analyzed are given for each individual symptoms score.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected from Visit 2 (Week 0) until Visit 9 (Week 24).
reported_events.desc: Adverse Events refer to the Safety Population consisting of all randomized subjects. One subject took the treatment under on demand regimen instead of continuous regimen. For the safety analyses, this subject was analyzed according to actual regimen received. Therefore, the Safety Population consisted of 62 subjects: 30 under the continuous regimen and 32 under the on demand regimen.

group.title: Continuous Treatment (SS)
group.description: 5 mg of Levocetirizine (LCTZ) was taken orally once a day.

group.title: On Demand Treatment (SS)
group.description: 5 mg of Levocetirizine (LCTZ) was taken whenever needed.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
